intro: Tecoma maximiliani, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters tall, featuring a woody stem and dense foliage. The plant produces striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a smooth texture and dark green color. Tecoma maximiliani is well adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
